page.title: 02The Norman landing in Sussex
page.content: {William the Conqueror}landed at{ {Pevensey}in 1066. When we looked at our area, just east of the landing site, it is easy to see why this was so popular. Although it would have been even more marshy in those days, it would still have been an easier landing than several other points along the coast. Once there{William} could secure his campaign. We found that this area of the{Levels}has always been considered vulnerable to enemy attack. We found evidence of defensive work from other wars. We also found the sites of several saltworks or{salt-pans}where sea water was trapped in shallow basins and had evaporated. This was a very important industry as it was the only way in early times to preserve meat and fish during the winter.
